title: Branislav Ivanovic believes players would prefer to play under Carlo Ancelotti that Jose Mourinho
text:
Sport Branislav Ivanovic believes players would prefer to play under Carlo Ancelotti that Jose Mourinho The Serb left Chelsea last month and has been discussing the difference in style between two of his former Blues managers Share Two former Chelsea bosses - two very different styles (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share Get   
Former Chelsea defender Branislav Ivanovic believes that the majority of players would prefer to spend their career playing for 'calm' Carlo Ancelotti, rather than Jose Mourinho. 
Ivanovic left Stamford Bridge last month after a nine-year spell which saw him play under both managers. 
The 32-year-old lost his place in the Blues' starting line-up this season and decided to call time on his Chelsea career after 377 appearances which saw him win ever major domestic and European honour, as he joined Zenit Saint Petersburg on a free transfer. 
And while Ivanovic says both men are great coaches, the Italian's style is more appealing to players in the long-term. Ivanovic left Chelsea in the January transfer window after nine seasons (Photo: Ian Walton) 
"Training was unique under Mourinho," he told Sport Express . "He sometimes plays mind games with the press, but when it comes to the most important things, the matches themselves, he is always very serious. If you want to play for Mourinho, you have to follow his demands. 
"Mourinho helps to develop the best qualities -- professional and personal. You can't be indifferent to him. You either love him or hate him. That's what makes him special. I am glad that I had a chance to work with him. Ivanovic says you either love or hate Mourinho (Photo: Clive Mason) 
"Ancelotti is very different. If players had a choice, I guess they would prefer to spend the entire career with Carlo. He is very calm and takes all the negative aspects on him, allowing the players to be comfortable. The results are equally good with both coaches." 
Ivanovic made only seven appearances at Chelsea this season and is looking forward to testing himself at Zenit. 
"I asked [the club] to release me if I received a suitable offer," he added. "Chelsea agreed, and I am very happy with that. 
"There was an option to go to China, but I want to play at a decent level and continue my development. That's why I chose Zenit." poll loading Who would you rather play under? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
